page.title: 20THE BRIDGE AT MONTFORD
page.content: The village of Montford Bridge is quite spread out, but with the focus of its 400 inhabitants at the bridge over the River Severn. The site has been a crossing point on the river for hundreds of years, having originally been a ford. The present bridge was first built in 1735 by French convicts. The designer, Thomas Telford, also planned the A5 which passes over it. The bridge is constructed of sandstone blocks. These came from Criggan, a nearby quarry with good access to the Severn. { { {The data for this area was compiled by {the students of Shrewsbury Sixth Form {College. } { Area Co-ordinator Brian Nelson
